subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Wednesday, 04 July, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Liverpool complete Torres signing
Liverpool sign Fernando Torres from Atletico Madrid on a six-year deal for a fee believed to be £20m.



 
Villa agree £8.5m Reo-Coker fee
Aston Villa agree a fee of £8.5m with fellow Premier League side West Ham for midfielder Nigel Reo-Coker.



 
Blades launch High Court appeal
Sheff Utd launch an appeal in the High Court claiming the arbitration panel made an error in judgement over the Carlos Tevez affair.








GOLF




Howell relieved with Tour return
David Howell believes his career plans have been heavily dented by his two-month lay-off with back and wrist problems.



 
Clarke caddie cool on Tiger link
Darren Clarke's caddie Billy Foster insists he has not been approached to work with world number one Tiger Woods next season.



 
Cash boost for 2007 Open champion
The winner of this year's Open at Carnoustie will pocket £750,000, an increase of £30,000 on last year.








MOTORSPORT




McLaren caught in Ferrari spy row
McLaren suspend a senior designer after rivals Ferrari say they have proof he received technical information from the Italian team.



 
Tyres 'helping Hamilton to shine'
Red Bull driver Mark Webber says Lewis Hamilton's stunning season has been aided by other drivers struggling with Formula One's new tyres.



 
I can overhaul Hamilton - Alonso
Fernando Alonso is adamant he can catch McLaren team-mate Lewis Hamilton's in the race for the Formula One drivers' championship.








FORMULA ONE




McLaren caught in Ferrari spy row
McLaren suspend a senior designer after rivals Ferrari say they have proof he received technical information from the Italian team.



 
Tyres 'helping Hamilton to shine'
Red Bull driver Mark Webber says Lewis Hamilton's stunning season has been aided by other drivers struggling with Formula One's new tyres.



 
I can overhaul Hamilton - Alonso
Fernando Alonso is adamant he can catch McLaren team-mate Lewis Hamilton's in the race for the Formula One drivers' championship.








ATHLETICS




Kluft set to make UK outdoor bow
Carolina Kluft will make her first outdoor appearance in the UK when she competes at the British Grand Prix next week.



 
Devonish edged out in Athens 100m
Britain's Marlon Devonish comes second behind Derrick Atkins of the Bahamas in the men's 100m at the Athens Grand Prix.



 
Pavey qualifies for World Champs
Britain's Jo Pavey qualifies for the World Championships after beating the 10,000 metres qualifying time in Watford.








CYCLING




Petacchi faces one-year dope ban
Alessandro Petacchi could miss the Tour de France after the Italian Olympic Committee charges him with doping.



 
Di Luca doping hearing postponed
The anti-doping hearings of Giro winner Danilo di Luca and his Italian compatriot Eddy Mazzoleni are postponed.



 
Vinokourov defends Ferrari link
Tour de France favourite Alexander Vinokourov insists he has nothing to hide about his relationship with trainer Dr Michele Ferrari.

Quotes of the Week

Strawberries and screams
